Article.Abstract: The large size of poxvirus genomes has stymied attempts to identify determinants recognized by CD8+ T cells and greatly impeded development of mouse smallpox vaccination models. Here, we use a vaccinia virus (VACV) expression library containing each of the predicted 258 open reading frames to identify five peptide determinants that account for approximately half of the VACV-specific CD8+ T cell response in C57BL/6 mice. We show that the primary immunodominance hierarchy is greatly affected by the route of VACV infection and the poxvirus strain used. Modified vaccinia virus ankara (MVA), a candidate replacement smallpox vaccine, failed to induce responses to two of the defined determinants. This could not be predicted by genomic comparison of viruses and is not due strictly to limited MVA replication in mice. Several determinants are immunogenic in cowpox and ectromelia (mousepox) virus infections, and immunization with the immunodominant determinant provided significant protection against lethal mousepox. These findings have important implications for understanding poxvirus immunity in animal models and bench-marking immune responses to poxvirus vaccines in humans.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification of poxvirus CD8+ T cell determinants to enable rational design and characterization of smallpox vaccines.
Article.Affiliations: Laboratory of Viral Diseases, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD 20892, USA. davidT@qimr.edu.au.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology; metabolism); Cloning, Molecular; DNA Primers; Dendritic Cells(metabolism); Epitopes(genetics; immunology; metabolism); Gene Library; Genes, MHC Class I(genetics); Immunization; Mice; Mice, Inbred C57BL; Open Reading Frames(genetics); Peptides(metabolism); Sequence Analysis, DNA; Smallpox Vaccine(genetics; immunology); Species Specificity; Spleen(cytology); Transfection; Vaccinia virus(metabolism)

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after infection. APCs are peptide pulsed syngeneic dendritic cell line DC2.4. This peptide binds MHC-I H-2<sup>b</sup> molecules, but is not recognized by T cells in the conditions tested.

MHC I molecules were purified from transfected EL-4 cells. In the conditions tested, IC50 value approximates true Kd value. The assay was performed in the presence of human β2m and protease inhibitors.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This epitope is conserved among Vaccinia strains WR and MVA, and in Cowpox virus (strain Brighton red), Ectromelia virus (Moscow), and Variola virus (Bangladesh).

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with 5x10<sup>5</sup> syngeneic DCs pulsed with B8R<sub>20-27</sub> epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed dendritic cells induce a low, but measurable CD8+ T cell response and provide significant, albeit incomplete, protection from intranasal challenge 3 weeks later with a lethal dose (300 PFU) of mousepox virus (ECTV, ectromelia virus) as shown by the delayed mortality in one experiment and enhanced survival in other, demonstrating this dominant epitope is cross-protective against pox virus species.
The IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after infection. APCs are peptide pulsed syngeneic dendritic cell line DC2.4.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after injection, showing that peptide specific responses can be induced by cowpox immunization.
IFN-gamma response is tested 8 days after injection, showing that peptide specific responses can be induced by mousepox virus (ECTV, ectromelia virus).

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Several strains were used as immunogen to assess the response against the epitope. Intraperitoneal and subcutaneous routes were compared.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after injection with vaccinia virus WR, Dryvax (USA smallpox vaccine), MVA (marginally replicative), and iA17L (not replicative) strains, showing that this peptide is the immunodominant epitope among the 5 determinants tested in every case. Dermal scarification induces a response even further skewed towards this immunodominant epitope. Memory responses measured 21 days after immunization with strain WR is shown to be of lower magnitude while still maintaining immune response hierarchy.

MHC I molecules were purified from transfected EL-4 cells. In the conditions tested, IC50 values approximate the true Kd value. The assay was performed in the presence of human β2m and protease inhibitors.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This epitope is conserved among Vaccinia strains WR and MVA, and in Cowpox virus (strain Brighton red), Ectromelia virus (Moscow), and Variola virus (Bangladesh).

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Several strains were used as immunogen to assess the response against the epitope. Intraperitoneal and subcutaneous routes were compared.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after injection with vaccinia virus WR, Dryvax (USA smallpox vaccine), and iA17L (not replicative) strains, showing that this epitope is the weakest among the 5 determinants tested. Dermal scarification induces even lower responses showing a suppression of responses against the subdominant epitopes by this route of infection as compared to the intraperitoneal route. Memory responses measured 21 days after immunization with strain WR are similarly low.

IFN-gamma response tested 7 days after injection with vaccinia virus MVA (marginally replicative) strain shows that this epitope, the weakest among the 5 determinants tested after infection with other strains, is the second strongest determinant in this strain.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after infection. APCs are peptide pulsed syngeneic dendritic cell line DC2.4.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after injection, showing no peptide specific response induced by cowpox virus.
IFN-gamma response is tested 8 days after injection, showing minimal peptide specific responses induced by mousepox virus (ECTV, ectromelia virus).
MHC molecules were purified from transfected EL-4 cells. In the conditions tested, IC50 value approximates true Kd value. The assay was performed in the presence of human β2m and protease inhibitors.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This epitope is conserved among Vaccinia strains WR and MVA, and in Cowpox virus (strain Brighton red) and Variola virus (Bangladesh). In Ectromelia virus (Moscow) there is an A to T substitution at position 2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-γ response tested 7 days after injection with vaccinia virus MVA (marginally replicative) strain shows that this epitope, with significant specific responses after infection with other strains, is not recognized after infection with MVA.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after vaccination, showing that peptide specific responses can be induced by cowpox virus immunization.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Several strains were used as immunogen to assess the response against the epitope. Intraperitoneal and subcutaneous routes were compared.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The IFN-gamma response, 7 days after vaccination with VACV WR, Dryvax (USA smallpox vaccine), and iA17L (not replicative) strains, shows that this epitope is a subdominant epitope among the 5 determinants tested. Subcutaneous scarification induces a weaker response showing a suppression of responses against subdominant epitopes by this route of infection as compared to the intraperitoneal route. Memory responses measured 21 days after immunization with strain WR is shown to be of lower magnitude, but still maintains the immune response hierarchy.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after infection. APCs are peptide pulsed syngeneic dendritic cell line DC2.4.

IFN-gamma response is tested 8 days after vaccination, showing that peptide specific response can be induced by mousepox virus (ECTV, ectromelia virus), even when there is a predicted sequence change in the determinant in the second residue (A to T).

MHC I molecules were purified from transfected EL-4 cells. In the conditions tested, IC50 values approximate true Kd value. The assay was performed in the presence of human β2m and protease inhibitors.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This epitope is conserved among Vaccinia strains WR and MVA, and in Cowpox virus (strain Brighton red), Ectromelia virus (Moscow), and Variola virus (Bangladesh).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after infection. APCs are peptide pulsed syngeneic dendritic cell line DC2.4.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Several strains were used as immunogen to assess the response against the epitope. Intraperitoneal and subcutaneous routes were compared.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The IFN-gamma response is weak 7 days after infection with vaccinia virus WR, Dryvax (USA smallpox vaccine), and iA17L (not replicative) strains, showing that this epitope is a a subdominant epitope among the 5 determinants tested. Memory responses measured 21 days after immunization with strain WR is shown to be of lower magnitude, but still maintains immune response hierarchy.

IFN-γ response tested 7 days after injection with vaccinia virus MVA (marginally replicative) strain shows that this epitope, with significant specific responses after infection with other strains, is not recognized after infection with MVA.

IFN-gamma response is negative 7 days after dermal scarification with vaccinia virus WR, showing a suppression of responses against subdominant epitopes by this route of infection compared to the intraperitoneal route.
IFN-gamma response is tested 8 days after vaccination, showing that peptide specific responses were not induced by cowpox immunization.
IFN-gamma response is tested 8 days after vaccination, showing that peptide specific responses were not induced by mousepox virus (ECTV, ectromelia virus) immunization.

MHC I molecules were purified from transfected EL-4 cells. In the conditions tested, IC50 value approximates true Kd value. The assay was performed in the presence of human β2m and protease inhibitors.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This epitope is conserved among Vaccinia strains WR and MVA, and in Cowpox virus (strain Brighton red) and Ectromelia virus (Moscow). In Variola virus (Bangladesh) there is an A to V substitution at position 6.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-gamma response is tested 8 days after vaccination, showing that peptide specific responses were not induced by mousepox virus (ECTV, ectromelia virus) immunization.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after vaccination, showing that peptide specific responses can be induced by cowpox virus immunization.
IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after infection. APCs are peptide pulsed syngeneic dendritic cell line DC2.4.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Several strains were used as immunogen to assess the response against the epitope. Intraperitoneal and subcutaneous routes were compared.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-gamma response is tested 7 days after vaccination with VACV WR, Dryvax (USA smallpox vaccine), MVA (marginally replicative), and iA17L (not replicative) strains, showing that this epitope is similarly subdominant among the 5 determinants tested. Subcutaneous scarification induces a response skewed towards the more immunodomiant epitope, with suppression of responses against subdominant epitopes. Memory responses measured 21 days after immunization with strain WR is shown to be of lower magnitude, but still maintains immune response hierarchy.

MHC I molecules were purified from transfected EL-4 cells. In the conditions tested, IC50 value approximates true Kd value. The assay was performed in the presence of human β2m and protease inhibitors.
